page.title: 07Climate in Woodhalls
page.content: The prevailing wind is south-west which brings in mild moist air from the Atlantic.However, being situated some 6 miles north of Dartmoor the area escapes much of the rain which is deposited on or around the moor. The yearly average rainfall is 9OOmm.An exceptionally dry year was 1964 with a fall of 698mm.and 1974 was exceptionally wet with 1156.3mm. Very hot and extremely cold weather is exceptional, although 33 degrees C.was recorded on 28.O6.76.One of the coldest nights was 18.O1.85. when the thermometer fell to 1O degrees C. Normally the autumns are fairly mild and dry. Foggy weather and thunderstorms are infrequent.Summers are often dry,sunny and warm. South -west gales in winter are frequent.
